displayName.text: Metropolitan Pediatrics New York City P.C.

formattedAddress: 254 W 87th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 254 W 87th St, New York, NY 10024-2800, USA

originalText.text: I really love the providers. We have seen many and all have been great. I have never had a long wait time in the lobby but sometimes waiting in the exam room can be torture especially with young kids wanting to touch everything. But we never feel rushed once our turn which is important. The only real issue I have had is with the front office. I have to jump through hoops to get bills rectified. Also I concur with other reviews about feeling like you are an inconvenience when you approach the desk.

text.text: I really love the providers. We have seen many and all have been great. I have never had a long wait time in the lobby but sometimes waiting in the exam room can be torture especially with young kids wanting to touch everything. originalText.text: The doctors at this office are great! But the assistance and office are completely helpless -- have no idea what they are doing. We have been trying to transfer medical records to a different city: requested the transfer, a week later nothing, called them again; they say that we have to request again and pay; we pay, wait three days; nothing; call them again -- they say that we have to submit request again... They personal did even care to remember the name of the child. In the last call the assistant just stopped talking and stand on the line quite. In addition, it is very difficult to reach them by phone, no one picks up. Sometimes a person picks up and says that the line is busy , and she has been hired to say that... And is not able to assist with questions about the practice.

originalText.text:
My son has been going to Metropolitan Pediatrics for several years. While I find the medical staff to be friendly and knowledgeable, their front desk staff are not! I only visit once per year because my son is not a sickly child and does not require many doctor visits, however each time we go the front desk staff are short when answering questions and make me feel like I'm bothering them.
I would suggest bi-annual customer service training. They are the face of the office, and if they are rude it will effect the practice as a whole.

text.text:

originalText.text: Dari the front desk receptionist was very unhelpful when trying to schedule and appointment for my son. If she is the representation of what the physicians are like I would find another provider. I was trying to make an appointment for my son was given the wrong information and when speaking to her she didn’t do anything to help.

originalText.text: We have been frequenting this practice for 12+ years now. Both children are patients here. We're ALWAYS treated well and seen promptly. If contacting after hours, messaging service is very efficient. Never waited more than 10 minutes for a call back.
